description.title: Description

edit_tools.title: Edition tools
edit_tools.elevation_threshold_explaination:
The purpose of smoothing is to smooth out GPS inaccuracies.
Because of these inaccuracies, it often happens that in a few meters of distance the altitude also rises and falls by a few meters, while the reality is a continuous slope.
Smoothing therefore works as follows:
  • We look for sections in which the altitude has varied within the configured threshold, and over a configured maximum distance.
  • For each section found, we take the starting altitude and the arrival altitude, and we smooth into a continuous slope.
  • In order to avoid losing the high points or low points of the route, if we find such a point in the middle of the section, we reduce the section to keep this point.

preferences.title: Preferences
preferences.traceMinMeters: Minimum distance between each recorded point
preferences.traceMinMeters_explaination:
A value that is too low may result in a low-quality track due to the imprecision of GPS.
A value that is too high may also produce a low-quality track with long straight lines.
It is also important to consider that the shorter the distance, the higher the number of recorded points, which can impact battery consumption during recording.
For a good compromise, we recommend a value of 15 meters (approximately 0.01 miles).
preferences.traceMinMillis: Minimum time between each recorded point
preferences.traceMinMillis_explaination:
If you want to limit the number of recorded points to reduce battery consumption, you can use a longer minimum time between each recorded point. The minimum distance between each point is also taken into account, so BOTH the minimum distance and minimum time must be reached before recording a new point.
We recommend setting the minimum time to 0 and only applying a distance limitation.
preferences.offlineMapMaxKeepDays: Number of days a downloaded map is valid
preferences.offlineMapMaxKeepDays_explaination: When you download a map to make it available offline, this setting indicates how long it will be retained. This also makes it possible to not download a map item if it has already been downloaded recently, saving time when downloading.
preferences.thunderforest_explaination: You can add maps from thunderforest.com if you have an account on their web site (a free account is available). Enter your API key below

time_calculation.title: Calculation of trail duration
time_calculation.base_speed_explaination: This speed is used for estimating trail durations. It is weighted according to the elevation and trail duration.
time_calculation.long_break_explaination: A stop is considered long when you have stayed within the configured perimeter for more than the minimum stop time. When a long stop is detected, we keep the minimum time in the normal trail duration, the rest is considered as stop time outside the normal trail duration.

offline_map.download_trail: Maps corresponding to the trail will be downloaded to be available offline
offline_map.download_map: Maps of the currently displayed area will be downloaded to be available offline
offline_map.max_zoom_explaination: The higher you select a zoom level, the more you will be able to zoom during your trail when you are offline, but consequently the longer the download will take and the more storage space will be required on your device.
offline_map.max_zoom_reco: A value between 15 and 17 is recommended. Below 15, the level of detail is often too low to see small paths clearly. Above 17, the download size is large, and is generally not necessary to perfectly follow a route.
offline_map.padding_explaination_for_trail: Percentage of the area to download in around the trail area (100% means only the trail area). Allows you to see more around the trail in offline mode.
offline_map.padding_explaination_for_map: Percentage of the area to download in around the currently displayed area (100% means only the trail area). Allows you to see a larger area in offline mode.

disabled_popup.title: GPS disabled
disabled_popup.message: Your GPS is disabled, please enable it to start a track.

logout.title: Sign out
logout.text:
Do you also want to delete all your data on this device?

If you delete your data from this device, it will be kept on our server but the next time you log in all your data will need to be downloaded again. If you keep it, only the updates will need to be downloaded.

If you delete it, make sure that the synchronization of your data on our server is complete, otherwise unsynchronized changes will be lost.

If you are on a shared device, it is recommended to delete your data.
